welcome.data: Warm-Up Prompt: “Which do you think is harder to style: a table or a form? Why? Think about your experience so far and the different HTML elements involved.” Have students share their answers in pairs and discuss as a class.

aim.data: Objective: Students will learn how to apply CSS styles to both tables and forms to improve readability, accessibility, and design consistency.

review.data: Review previous lessons on form and table structure, CSS selectors, and box model. Ask: “What do we need to keep in mind when styling input elements or aligning data in a table?”

relevant.data: Mini-lecture and live demo on styling forms and tables with CSS. Cover padding, borders, zebra-striping, focus effects, and use of WebStorm.

interactive.data: Students style a form and table according to a provided mockup. Implement hover, padding, and text alignment with CSS.

ownership.data: Students apply CSS styles to their own previous form and table assignments, using professional design principles.

resonate.data: Exit Ticket: 'How can CSS improve user experience in forms and tables? What did you find most challenging to style today?'

supplies.data: Computers with WebStorm, previous form/table HTML files, mockup images (PDF/PNG), instructor CSS solution pack
